supporting_text: The NAP emphasizes the importance of a One Health approach, addressing human health, animal health, and agriculture.
The NAP includes specific actions aimed at increasing awareness and improving practices in human health.
The NAP outlines strategies to enhance animal health practices and address antimicrobial use in animals.
The NAP includes actions related to environmental sanitation and hygiene.
The NAP addresses agricultural practices and the use of antimicrobials in food production.
The NAP includes a monitoring and evaluation plan to track progress.
The NAP sets specific targets for awareness and behavior change within defined timeframes.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and improving antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes an operational plan with budget allocations for various activities.
The NAP assesses future budget requirements for its activities.
The NAP establishes a national steering committee for AMR coordination.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen the legislative framework for antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes initiatives to integrate AMR education into training programs for healthcare professionals.
The NAP outlines public awareness campaigns targeting various community groups.
The NAP emphasizes collaboration with international organizations for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes the establishment of an AMR surveillance unit for data collection and analysis.
The NAP includes strategies to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP outlines specific strategies for sanitation and infection prevention.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP mandates the rational use of antibiotics through regulatory measures.
The NAP encourages participation in international research collaborations.
